metadata.title: CVE-2024-26773 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ext4:avoid allocating blocks from corrupted group in ext4_mb_try_best_found()Determine if the group block bitmap is corrupted before using ac_b_ex inext4_mb_try_best_found() to avoid allocating blocks from a group with acorrupted block bitmap in the following concurrency and making thesituation worse. ext4_mb_regular_allocator ext4_lock_group(sb, group)ext4_mb_good_group // check if the group bbitmap is corruptedext4_mb_complex_scan_group // Scan group gets ac_b_ex but doesn't use itext4_unlock_group(sb, group) ext4_mark_group_bitmap_corrupted(group) // Theblock bitmap was corrupted during // the group unlock gap.ext4_mb_try_best_found ext4_lock_group(ac->ac_sb, group)ext4_mb_use_best_found mb_mark_used // Allocating blocks in block bitmapcorrupted group

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
